licensing statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way the area manager at 517-243-9743.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Use a date application to calculate when reports are due. This will ensure the
reports are completed within the required time frame.
2

V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The CAP was in response to the Special Inveistagion 2024SIC0001311. This
Special Investigation occurred on 4/5/2024 and involved a complaint of staff
punching a youth during an altercation. The CAP was approved on 10/8/2024 and
inovlves a monitoring goal with three action steps. The first action step involves the
staff involved in the allegations meeting with the Chief Administrator to discuss
strategies, identifying the staff’s decision making, and exploring other options staff
could have used. The verification step involves documentation being placed in the
staff’s personnel file and catalogued in annual training summaries. This action step
has been reviewed once since being approved and the facility provided
documentation of meetings between the staff and Chief Administrator occurring on
a regular basis. Documentation also was found in the personnel file of the staff. The
second action step invovles the staff being assigned for additonal refresher training
on Management of Aggressive Behavior (MOAB). This trainng is to be documented
in the staff’s personnel file and catalogued in the annual training summaries.
Documentation in the personnel file indicates the staff completed the refresher
training on 4/11/2024. The third action step involves staff have ongoing evaluations
by administration and supervision. These actions of evaluation are to be
documented and placed in staff’s personnel file. Documentation provided during the
CAP review supports the facility completing these evaluations and placing
documentation in the personnel file.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
3

Chief Administrator Assessment
Not Applicable
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed reported receiving significant training to help them provide healthy
services to the youth. They also reported a belief that administration is supportive
of staff and open to hearing about ideas the staff have about changes that bring
more positive interactions with youth.
All the youth currently in the two programs were interviewed and all reported a
positive belief about the facility. Although, they would like to be at home, they report
staff are appropriate and provide safety for them. They all reported feeling safe at
the facility and reported staff are always supervising them. These youth also
reported receiving numerous services to help them make better choices in their
decisions.
Description of Agency Walk Through
This is a primarily single-story facility with a significant new addition. There are two
areas that have a mezzanine level. The new addition added twice as much space
and doubled the capacity of youth in the facility. Currently, they are not using the
new addition because the facility has not been able to hire the appropriate number
of staff to provide appropriate supervision. The facility is very clean and excellently
maintained in all aspects. All plumbing was in working order. Each room is
appropriately furnished, and cleaning supplies are locked as required. Medications
are also locked, and the medication log is being appropriately completed. The
kitchen was very clean, and the menu was posted for youth to observed. Employee
documentation required to be posted was appropriately posted. Youth’s personal
property was stored and documented on the youth’s inventory sheets. Emergency
drills and room check logs were reviewed and found to be appropriate.
4

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
1/27/2025
